MyAgent

public MyAgent(Connect4Game game,
               boolean iAmRed)
Constructs a new agent, giving it the game and telling it whether it is Red or Yellow.

Parameters:
game - The game the agent will be playing.
iAmRed - True if the agent is Red, False if the agent is Yellow.
Method Detail

canWin

public int canWin(char myColor)
Returns the column that would allow the agent to win.

Parameters:
myColor - the color of the agent
Returns:
the column that would allow the agent to win, returns -1 if no win possible

getLowestEmptyIndex

public int getLowestEmptyIndex(Connect4Column column)
Returns the index of the top empty slot in a particular column.

Parameters:
column - The column to check.
Returns:
the index of the top empty slot in a particular column; -1 if the column is already full.

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Returns the name of this agent.

Specified by:
getName in class Agent
Returns:
the agent's name

move

public void move()
The move method is run every time it is this agent's turn in the game. You may assume that when move() is called, the game has at least one open slot for a token, and the game has not already been won. By the end of the move method, the agent should have placed one token into the game at some point.

Specified by:
move in class Agent

moveOnColumn

public void moveOnColumn(int columnNumber)
Drops a token into a particular column so that it will fall to the bottom of the column. If the column is already full, nothing will change.

Parameters:
columnNumber - The column into which to drop the token.

randomMove

public int randomMove()
Returns a random valid move. If your agent doesn't know what to do, making a random move can allow the game to go on anyway.

Returns:
a random valid move.

twoAway

public int twoAway(char myColor,
                   char theirColor)
Returns the column that would allow the agent to be one move away from winning. Like the win method, but plays two hypothetical moves to determine whether any combination of two moves would result in the agent winning. Also checks if the move sets the opposite player up to win

Parameters:
myColor - the color of the agent to be tested
theirColor - the color of the opposing agent
Returns:
the column that would allow the agent to be one move away from winning, returns -1 if no win possible
